event_text: m_c notices bamboo growing in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} nest!

r_c has a wonderful idea for decorating m_c's nest! m_c wakes up in the middle of the night with bamboo brushing {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} face. Despite the slight spook it gave m_c, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/mew/mews} to r_c in the morning a thank you for the cool surprise!

m_c's eyes dilate as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/focus/focuses} on a rabbit near the dirt-place. m_c has been taught all {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} life that hunting was the only thing that a warrior did near rabbits... but this one was so cute. m_c wanders towards it, and quickly befriends it!

r_c spots acc_singular near camp. Before r_c can rip {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} way through camp and to the acc_singular, m_c stops {PRONOUN/r_c/object} and tells {PRONOUN/r_c/object} that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/want/wants} it as a pet. r_c opens {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mouth to hiss at m_c, but the kit bounds over to the acc_singular. Guess it's too late to catch it...
m_c eyes a pink-nosed rat that wandered into the nursery. Before r_c can even think about stopping {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, m_c befriends the weird little thing with a piece of grass.
m_c finds a worm in camp on a rainy day! m_c decides to keep it.

r_c watches with exhausted eyes as m_c violently digs a hole off to the side of c_n camp, flinging dirt everywhere. m_c approaches less than a minute later, covered in dirt and with a long worm in their jaws. Mumbled, m_c asks if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can keep {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new friend. Exasperated, r_c tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} yes and to not dig holes in camp, and then tiredly walks over to clean up m_c's mess.
